trans-unit.source: Represents the Conditions element specified in [Saml2Core, 2.5.1].
For more information about the element that this class represents, see the SAML V2.0 Core specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Conditions"></xref> class.
Gets a collection that specifies the audience to which the assertion is addressed.
[Saml2Core, 2.5.1]
The AudienceRestrictions element.
A collection of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AudienceRestriction"></xref> that specifies the audience for the assertion.
If the collection is empty no restrictions on the audience apply.
Gets or sets the earliest time instant at which the assertion is valid.
[Saml2Core, 2.5.1]
The NotBefore attribute.
A nullable <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that contains the time instant in UTC.
A `null` value indicates that the attribute is not present.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Conditions.NotOnOrAfter"></xref> property is not `null` and an attempt to set a value that occurs on or after the time instant specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Conditions.NotOnOrAfter"></xref> property occurs.
Gets or sets the time instant at which the assertion has expired.
[Saml2Core, 2.5.1]
The NotOnOrAfter attribute.
A nullable <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that contains the time instant in UTC.
A `null` value indicates that the attribute is not present.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Conditions.NotBefore"></xref> property is not `null` and an attempt to set a value that occurs before the time instant specified by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Conditions.NotBefore"></xref> property occurs.
Gets a value that specifies whether the assertion should be used immediately and must not be retained for future use.
[Saml2Core, 2.5.1]
The OneTimeUse element.
`true` if the assertion should be used immediately; otherwise, `false`.

Gets or sets the limitations that the asserting party imposes on relying parties that wish to subsequently act as asserting parties themselves and issue assertions of their own on the basis of the information contained in the original assertion.
[Saml2Core, 2.5.1]
The ProxyRestriction element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2ProxyRestriction"></xref> that contains the restrictions placed on subsequent asserting parties.
